item.title: Helldivers 2 Fan Shows Off 3D-Printed Helmet
item.description:
Summary

  • A Helldivers 2 fan used 3D printing to create a custom helmet, embracing democracy.
  • The creator used the Bambu Lab P1S printer to create the helmet, and the piece was printed in seven parts and held together with magnets.
  • Helldivers 2 players can equip different armor sets by way of the Armory, and purchase more through the Superstore.

A Helldivers 2 fan has made a custom helmet from the shooter using 3D printing, and the community is content with democracy being spread. Helldivers 2 players can equip different armor sets by way of the Armory, or by using one of the Bridge’s Hellpods to suit up before dropping into missions. There are several light, medium, and heavy armor sets to choose from, decorated in a variety of styles and colors, and all can be purchased through the Superstore with Super Credits.

The third-person co-op shooter is a direct sequel to the 2015 game of the same name, set in the 22nd century following the titular band of shock troops tasked with combating Terminids and Automatons. Following monumental success, Helldivers 2 's game director is already thinking about Arrowhead Game Studio’s next project. Johan Pilestedt said the team was open to suggestions from fans as part of the brainstorming process for the developer’s next title. However, regular updates and content drops will still populate Helldivers 2 throughout 2025.

Posted on Reddit by Renogamer, a photo was shared on the Helldivers 2 subreddit showing the creator wearing a black, 3D-printed helmet. The fan explained they used the Bambu Lab P1S printer to create the helmet, and the piece was printed in seven parts: the top, back, mouthpiece, eyepiece, two vents, and visor. Furthermore, the creator held all the pieces together using magnets, so it’s easy to remove. There’s a litany of great armor perks in Helldivers 2 , but none quite capture the added touch of custom-made magic.

Helldivers 2 Fan 3D-Prints Custom Helmet in the Name of Democracy

Additionally, the creator noted they used files on Bambu’s Maker World website to print the finished product, and compliments flooded in, particularly about the visor. Since the visor is slightly transparent, one Redditor thought the creator used staring eyes from a popular Helldivers meme to create the same effect, but the creator confirmed it’s their eyes that are visible. Others remarked that the fan’s custom helmet was a sign of democracy spreading, riffing off of Helldiver’s 2 missions that are frequently centered around spreading democracy and fighting for it.

In addition to 3D-printing armor, the shooter’s creative community is also accustomed to making original designs, including one Helldivers 2 fan who made stunning armor concepts. The shooter found fame for its cinematic interactions between the Helldivers and enemies, and the expressionless helmets worn by the troops added to the scenes’ comical value.

item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Beat Cliff (January 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Beat Cliff in Pokemon GO? (January 2025)
  • Cliff’s First Phase Counters
  • Cliff’s Second Phase Counters
  • Cliff’s Third Phase Counters

Pokemon GO Cliff's Shadow Pokemon lineup has changed for the month of January 2025. Cliff has multiple Shadow monsters, each with amazing battle abilities and prowess. You must have proper meta-knowledge and counter-selection to defeat the Team GO Rocket leader.

Pokemon GO Team GO Rocket's leaders are among the most powerful antagonists in the game. Regarding Cliff’s battle roster, it comprises 7 Shadow Pokemon. Each of Cliff's Shadow Pokemon is extremely powerful and requires proper counters, but you must first find the leader to battle him. Win against several Team GO Rocket Grunts and collect 6 Mysterious Components to build a Rocket Radar , which can navigate you to Cliff . This guide details the Team GO Rocket leader Cliff’s Shadow Pokemon for January 2025 and the best counters against them.

How to Beat Cliff in Pokemon GO? (January 2025)

Cliff has a total of 7 Shadow Pokemon, and each of them is a capable fighter in Pokemon GO . The battle with Cliff has 3 rounds; the 1st round always starts with a single Pokemon . The 2nd and 3rd rounds are unpredictable ; the leader has 3 potential picks for each of these rounds . One requires extreme meta-knowledge and proper counters to win the battle.

Phase

Pokemon

First Phase

Galarian Shadow Zigzagoon

Second Phase

  • Shadow Venusaur
  • Shadow Marowak
  • Shadow Aerodactyl

Third Phase

  • Shadow Tyranitar
  • Shadow Obstagoon
  • Shadow Crobat

Cliff’s First Phase Counters

Cliff always begins with Galarian Shadow Zigzagoon for the battle’s first phase. It is a Dark and Normal-type Pokemon with boosted offensive prowess as a Shadow monster.

Galarian Shadow Zigzagoon Counters

  • Type: Dark and Normal
  • Weakness: Fighting, Bug, and Fairy-type moves
  • Resistance: Dark, Psychic, and Ghost-type moves

Sacred Sword (Fighting-type) (Legacy)

Marshadow

Low Kick (Fighting-type)

Sacred Sword (Fighting-type)

Counter (Fighting-type)

Dynamic Punch (Fighting-type)

Cliff’s Second Phase Counters

The battle’s second phase comes up with significant uncertainty. Cliff’s Pokemon choice is not constant like in the first phase, so Pokemon GO trainers must prepare to battle against the likes of Shadow Venusaur, Shadow Marowak, and Shadow Aerodactyl. One must analyze the game's meta to counter these opponents effectively.

Shadow Venusaur Counters

  • Type: Grass and Poison
  • Weakness: Fire, Flying, Ice,and Psychic-type moves
  • Resistance: Electric, Fairy, Fighting, Water, and Grass-type moves

Cliff’s Third Phase Counters

The third phase also proves to be a battle of prediction. Cliff has three choices he can pick for the final phase: Shadow Tyranitar, Shadow Obstagoon, or Shadow Crobat. Pokemon GO trainers must carefully select counters that can go toe-to-toe with the Team GO Rocket leader's roster.

item.title: Marvel Rivals' Season 1 Heroes Are an Unexpected But Welcome Surprise
item.description:
Marvel Rivals has confirmed the start date for Season 1 after the game entered Season 0 last month. In addition to a Season 1 start date of January 9, Marvel Rivals also confirmed that The Fantastic Four will be added as playable heroes when the new season drops. While the addition of these characters is exciting to be sure, the timing of their addition to Marvel Rivals ' roster seems to be jumping the gun a bit.

The Fantastic Four coming to Marvel Rivals has been the game's worst-kept secret since the heroes were leaked via datamine even before the game's official launch. Even with the "when" left up in the air, these leaks confirmed that Marvel's First Family would be heading to Marvel Rivals eventually. However, their addition coming so soon after release is a bit of a curveball when there seemed to be a much more perfect window for their addition coming later in 2025.

Marvel Rivals will be getting a Season 1 trailer on January 6 to give players their first official in-game looks at Mister Fantastic, Invisible Woman, Human Torch, and The Thing.

Marvel Rivals Adding The Fantastic Four With Season 1 is Oddly Timed

Adding the Heroes to Coincide with the MCU Movie Seemed More Likely

As inevitable as The Fantastic Four seemed as Marvel Rivals heroes, choosing them to headline Season 1 so early in 2025 seems like NetEase could be putting the cart before the horse. 2025 is already set to be a big year for Fantastic Four fans with the MCU's The Fantastic Four: First Steps set to release in theaters in July. With this release date already teed up for Marvel Rivals to knock out of the park with a well-timed collaboration, releasing the Fantastic Four as playable characters so far in advance is somewhat unexpected.

Part of the reason for this disconnect between The Fantastic Four's Marvel Rivals debut and the upcoming MCU film could be to give players a chance to get to know the characters more ahead of the film's release. The Fantastic Four are certainly not as obscure of Marvel characters as Jeff the Land Shark and Luna Snow, who have already grown in popularity thanks to Marvel Rivals. However, the heroes have been out of the mainstream limelight for some time, which could warrant ample time for fans to familiarize themselves with the heroes via Marvel Rivals in anticipation of The Fantastic Four: First Steps ' release.

The Fantastic Four: First Steps is slated to release on July 25, 2025.

The Fantastic Four's Addition Sets a Hopeful Precedent for Future Marvel Rivals Seasons

Regardless of the timing of The Fantastic Four in Marvel Rivals , the addition of four new characters at the start of Season 1 is exciting in and of itself. Although Marvel Rivals launched with 33 playable characters, it remained unclear how many characters players could expect to see added each season. Other hero shooters like Overwatch 2 have typically stuck with one new hero per season, but Marvel Rivals adding four in a single season bodes well for future seasonal additions.

The Fantastic Four being added so much earlier than was anticipated also sets a precedent for characters to be added long before they receive a tie-in with other Marvel media like the MCU films. For example, players may see Blade join Marvel Rivals much earlier than his MCU appearance or the upcoming Arkane-developed game. With Marvel Rivals having such a deep catalog of characters to pull from, it's not that surprising to see four new heroes join in a single season, but the distance they're releasing from the highly-anticipated MCU film makes them a more than welcome surprise to kick off Season 1.

item.title: Persona 4 Golden: How To Increase Knowledge
item.description:
While most of the social stats in Persona 4 Golden are focused on unlocking additional ranks of your Social Links, Knowledge is even more important because it will determine how you do during exams. Exams will happen periodically throughout the game and are easy ways to get closer to your classmates and get powerful accessories.

Knowledge is arguably the most important social stat because of exams, and there are a few ways to increase it. Here are the various things you can do during your free time to help you rank up your Knowledge before exams start.

How To Rank Up Knowledge In Persona 4 Golden

Study

You can study during the day in the Library or in your room at night . The Library is found on the far side of the second floor of the school opposite to your classroom, along the back left side of the hallway. Whenever you're home, you can study by interacting with your desk in the bottom left corner of your room. No matter where you are studying, if it is raining you will get a bonus and get more knowledge for studying.

You can also read the Expert Study Methods book to get more knowledge every time you study.

Getting Questions Right In Class

Various days in class will have you be called on to answer a question. Getting the answer correct will give you a point in Knowledge . It's highly recommended you look up a guide on these answers as they are free Knowledge points that don't take up any time and quickly add up.

Eat At Aiya

When it's raining Chinese Diner Aiya offers the Mega Beef Bowl Challenge for 3,000 Yen. Attempting this challenge and failing gives you one point in three random social stats, one of which is Knowledge, and possibly courage. This is a good way to rank up all your stats randomly, but Knowledge won't always be given.

Read Books

You can buy books at Yomenaido Bookstore in the Central Shopping District, with more being sold as you progress through the story. These books can be read at home, if you're not spending time with Dojima, by interacting with the couch in your room , with one chapter being read a night. Each chapter read will give points in Knowledge until you finish the book. The following books give Knowledge:

  • The Ramen Way
  • The Gentle Way
  • The Divine Way
  • Guide To Pests
  • Who Am I?

Reading Hyperspeed Reading lets you read two chapters in one sitting.

item.title: Genshin Impact Fans Spot Something Unusual About Hu Tao's New Skin
item.description:
Summary

  • Hu Tao's new outfit release surprised fans.
  • Similarities between Hu Tao's and Childe's outfits have been noted.

Genshin Impact fans have spotted an interesting detail about a newly released outfit for the fan-favorite five-star character Hu Tao. The developer has not introduced many cosmetics over the years, but when it does, it is usually around Genshin Impact 's two annual events: the Lantern Rite Festival and the Summer Event.

The Lantern Rite Festival celebrates the Lunar New Year, which is why the event is always hosted in the Liyue region, inspired by Chinese culture. Many Genshin Impact fans expected Hu Tao's skin to be available once Lantern Rite arrives in the second part of the update, but HoYoverse actually released it on January 1.

Since its release, many fans have been praising HoYoverse for adding new skins for older characters such as Hu Tao. However, while the skin received mostly positive reviews, some fans noticed an unusual detail about its design. An interesting post on the main Genshin Impact subreddit compared Hu Tao's new skin with Childe's regular outfit, noting that they seem very similar. Fans pointed out that the two outfits share several similarities in both style and design. Both feature a predominantly white color theme with smaller red accents. They also incorporate similar Chinese-inspired patterns, which is not surprising since Hu Tao is from Liyue, and Childe was released during Genshin Impact 's Liyue arc. The post garnered significant attention in the community, amassing over 2.1k upvotes.

Genshin Impact Fans Highlight Similarities Between Hu Tao's Skin and Childe's Outfit

Even though many fans claim they can't unsee these similarities now, they still don't mind equipping Hu Tao with this new outfit. Moreover, some claim it's a shame that both characters are DPS-focused, making it difficult to use them together in a team composition. However, pairing their elements could still trigger Vaporize, one of the best Elemental Reactions in Genshin Impact .

Players who want to get Hu Tao's new outfit should probably do so during Genshin Impact Version 5.3, as it is available at a discounted price for the duration of the update. Hu Tao is not the only Pyro user receiving a new outfit in this update; HoYoverse's Special Program confirmed that Xiangling will also get a new outfit during the Lantern Rite Festival.

Unlike Hu Tao's outfit, which is only available through the in-game shop, players will be able to obtain Xiangling's new outfit for free. All they will probably need to do is complete a few quests. However, it should be noted that the only opportunity to get this skin for free will be during this year's Genshin Impact Lantern Rite event.
